e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it removes the biased under-reporting of earnings, fostering transparency and trust with investors. While some investors may initially misinterpret the new policy, it ultimately aligns with ethical financial practices and reduces the risk of legal liability. Emphasizing accurate reporting will strengthen the company’s reputation and build a more sustainable relationship with stakeholders in the long term.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency in financial disclosures, ensuring that all relevant information is presented clearly to investors. It should avoid misleading practices, maintain compliance with regulatory standards, and foster trust between the company and its stakeholders. Moreover, considering the varying levels of sophistication among investors, the policy should strive to provide straightforward information accessible to all, thereby promoting fairness in the investment process.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate the transition to the new policy to investors, especially to those who may not be aware of the change. Additionally, I would inquire about their strategies for addressing any potential misunderstandings or backlash from the market once the new reporting begins, ensuring that we manage investor expectations effectively.
